[HEADING] Euro-Asian MBA-MSc
[HEADING] EURO-ASIAN MBA-MSc PROGRAMME(BY COURSEWORK - 46 CREDITS)
[HEADING] CAREER OPPORTUNITY
[HEADING] PROGRAMME STRUCTURE
[HEADING] ENTRY REQUIREMENT
[HEADING] PROGRAMME FEE
[HEADING] BROCHURE
[HEADING] HANDBOOK
[HEADING] CONTACT US
[HEADING] APPLY NOW
Euro-Asian MBA-MSC
The Euro-Asian MBA-MSc programme is an exciting partnership designed in collaboration with the University of Glasgow (UofG), allowing you to combine a one-year MSc from our partner university in European with our master's degrees.
This programme draws on both European and Southeast Asian-specific business experiences, giving you a unique insight into leadership in today's international business world.
You'll spend your first year studying in Malaysia on the UM MBA programme before joining Glasgow for the second part of your journey for UofG MSc programme.
At Glasgow, you'll have the choice of one of three world-class MSc programmes, including:
EURO ASIAN MBA MSC MINI HANDBOOK 2025-2026
Should you wish to refer to the handbook from a previous session, kindly scroll down and select the 'Handbook' tab
YEAR 1 - MBA (UM)
In Universiti Malaya, you need to take core courses.
YEAR 2 - MSc (UofG)
Once in Glasgow, choose between one of three world-class, triple accredited MSc programmes, including International Business, Environment & Sustainable Development, or Financial Technology (FinTech).
International Business
International Business will provide you with advanced knowledge and skills in international business, cross-cultural management and entrepreneurship in an international context.
Environment & Sustainable Development
This programme will give you the tools to apply economic analysis to a range of environmental management problems focusing on developing countries.
Financial Technology (FinTech)
Fast-moving trends in technology and banking have altered the landscape for those seeking to make an impact in the world of finance. The MSc Financial Technology provides an advanced education in the multiple converging skills and knowledge bases that are required by the organisations of the future.
For more information about the programme, please visit Glasgow website here :https://www.gla.ac.uk
Marketing UnitGround Floor, Azman Hashim Building,Faculty of Business and Economics,Universiti Malaya,50603 Kuala Lumpur,MALAYSIATel : +603-7967 3918 / 3820Email: umfbe_mac@um.edu.my
NOTE: Before you begin the online application process, please ensure that you meet ALL of the entry requirements for your preferred degree. You are required to upload ALL original evidence in the online application. Incomplete applications will not be processed. The Faculty does not issue a conditional offer letter to applicants. The University processing fee is not refundable.
Last Update: 28/07/2025
• Faculty of Business and Economics
• umfpe@um.edu.my
• +603 7967 3800
• Home
• Euro-Asian MBA-MSc
• International Business
• Environment & Sustainable Development or
• Financial Technology (FinTech)
• 9 core courses
• 2 optional courses
• 1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertation
• 4 core courses
• 2 optional courses
• 1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertation
• 7 core courses
• Optional courses
• Fintech Pathways Project, choosing from an Industry, Start-up or Research Pathway

46 CREDITS)The Euro-Asian MBA-MSc programme is an exciting partnership designed in collaboration with the University of Glasgow (UofG), allowing you to combine a one-year MSc from our partner university in European with our master's degrees.This programme draws on both European and Southeast Asian-specific business experiences, giving you a unique insight into leadership in today's international business world. You'll spend your first year studying in Malaysia on the UM MBA programme before joining Glasgow for the second part of your journey for UofG MSc programme. At Glasgow, you'll have the choice of one of three world-class MSc programmes, including: International BusinessEnvironment & Sustainable Development orFinancial Technology (FinTech)Postgraduate HandbookEURO ASIAN MBA MSC MINI HANDBOOK 2025-2026  Should you wish to refer to the handbook from a previous session, kindly scroll down and select the 'Handbook' tabCAREER OPPORTUNITYPROGRAMME STRUCTUREYEAR 1 - MBA (UM)In Universiti Malaya, you need to take core courses.YEAR 2 - MSc (UofG)Once in Glasgow, choose between one of three world-class, triple accredited MSc programmes, including International Business, Environment & Sustainable Development, or Financial Technology (FinTech).International BusinessInternational Business will provide you with advanced knowledge and skills in international business, cross-cultural management and entrepreneurship in an international context.9 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationEnvironment & Sustainable DevelopmentThis programme will give you the tools to apply economic analysis to a range of environmental management problems focusing on developing countries.4 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationFinancial Technology (FinTech)Fast-moving trends in technology and banking have altered the landscape for those seeking to make an impact in the world of finance. The MSc Financial Technology provides an advanced education in the multiple converging skills and knowledge bases that are required by the organisations of the future.7 core coursesOptional coursesFintech Pathways Project, choosing from an Industry, Start-up or Research PathwayFor more information about the programme, please visit Glasgow website here :https://www.gla.ac.ukENTRY REQUIREMENT  Entry Requirement (Malaysian & International)  PROGRAMME FEE Fee InformationBROCHUREHANDBOOK List of HandbooksCONTACT USMarketing UnitGround Floor, Azman Hashim Building,Faculty of Business and Economics,Universiti Malaya,50603 Kuala Lumpur,MALAYSIATel : +603-7967 3918 / 3820Email: umfbe_mac@um.edu.myAPPLY NOW  Apply Now  NOTE: Before you begin the online application process, please ensure that you meet ALL of the entry requirements for your preferred degree. You are required to upload ALL original evidence in the online application. Incomplete applications will not be processed. The Faculty does not issue a conditional offer letter to applicants. The University processing fee is not refundable.

The Euro-Asian MBA-MSc programme is an exciting partnership designed in collaboration with the University of Glasgow (UofG), allowing you to combine a one-year MSc from our partner university in European with our master's degrees.This programme draws on both European and Southeast Asian-specific business experiences, giving you a unique insight into leadership in today's international business world. You'll spend your first year studying in Malaysia on the UM MBA programme before joining Glasgow for the second part of your journey for UofG MSc programme. At Glasgow, you'll have the choice of one of three world-class MSc programmes, including: International BusinessEnvironment & Sustainable Development orFinancial Technology (FinTech)Postgraduate HandbookEURO ASIAN MBA MSC MINI HANDBOOK 2025-2026  Should you wish to refer to the handbook from a previous session, kindly scroll down and select the 'Handbook' tab
YEAR 1 - MBA (UM)In Universiti Malaya, you need to take core courses.YEAR 2 - MSc (UofG)Once in Glasgow, choose between one of three world-class, triple accredited MSc programmes, including International Business, Environment & Sustainable Development, or Financial Technology (FinTech).International BusinessInternational Business will provide you with advanced knowledge and skills in international business, cross-cultural management and entrepreneurship in an international context.9 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationEnvironment & Sustainable DevelopmentThis programme will give you the tools to apply economic analysis to a range of environmental management problems focusing on developing countries.4 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationFinancial Technology (FinTech)Fast-moving trends in technology and banking have altered the landscape for those seeking to make an impact in the world of finance. The MSc Financial Technology provides an advanced education in the multiple converging skills and knowledge bases that are required by the organisations of the future.7 core coursesOptional coursesFintech Pathways Project, choosing from an Industry, Start-up or Research PathwayFor more information about the programme, please visit Glasgow website here :https://www.gla.ac.uk

Please select :                                     Euro-Asian MBA-MSc Master of Accounting Master of Applied Statistics (MAppStats) Master of Business Administration Master of Development Studies (MDS) Master of Economics (MEc) Master of Management Master of Marketing Master of Public Administration by Coursework (MPA) Euro-Asian MBA-MSC
[CARD]
EURO-ASIAN MBA-MSc PROGRAMME(BY COURSEWORK - 46 CREDITS)
The Euro-Asian MBA-MSc programme is an exciting partnership designed in collaboration with the University of Glasgow (UofG), allowing you to combine a one-year MSc from our partner university in European with our master's degrees.This programme draws on both European and Southeast Asian-specific business experiences, giving you a unique insight into leadership in today's international business world. You'll spend your first year studying in Malaysia on the UM MBA programme before joining Glasgow for the second part of your journey for UofG MSc programme. At Glasgow, you'll have the choice of one of three world-class MSc programmes, including: International BusinessEnvironment & Sustainable Development orFinancial Technology (FinTech)Postgraduate HandbookEURO ASIAN MBA MSC MINI HANDBOOK 2025-2026  Should you wish to refer to the handbook from a previous session, kindly scroll down and select the 'Handbook' tab
[CARD]
EURO-ASIAN MBA-MSc PROGRAMME(BY COURSEWORK - 46 CREDITS)
EURO-ASIAN MBA-MSc PROGRAMME(BY COURSEWORK - 46 CREDITS)
[CARD]
The Euro-Asian MBA-MSc programme is an exciting partnership designed in collaboration with the University of Glasgow (UofG), allowing you to combine a one-year MSc from our partner university in European with our master's degrees.This programme draws on both European and Southeast Asian-specific business experiences, giving you a unique insight into leadership in today's international business world. You'll spend your first year studying in Malaysia on the UM MBA programme before joining Glasgow for the second part of your journey for UofG MSc programme. At Glasgow, you'll have the choice of one of three world-class MSc programmes, including: International BusinessEnvironment & Sustainable Development orFinancial Technology (FinTech)Postgraduate HandbookEURO ASIAN MBA MSC MINI HANDBOOK 2025-2026  Should you wish to refer to the handbook from a previous session, kindly scroll down and select the 'Handbook' tab
[CARD]
CAREER OPPORTUNITY
CAREER OPPORTUNITY
[CARD]
PROGRAMME STRUCTURE
YEAR 1 - MBA (UM)In Universiti Malaya, you need to take core courses.YEAR 2 - MSc (UofG)Once in Glasgow, choose between one of three world-class, triple accredited MSc programmes, including International Business, Environment & Sustainable Development, or Financial Technology (FinTech).International BusinessInternational Business will provide you with advanced knowledge and skills in international business, cross-cultural management and entrepreneurship in an international context.9 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationEnvironment & Sustainable DevelopmentThis programme will give you the tools to apply economic analysis to a range of environmental management problems focusing on developing countries.4 core courses2 optional courses1 independent piece of research work in the form of a dissertationFinancial Technology (FinTech)Fast-moving trends in technology and banking have altered the landscape for those seeking to make an impact in the world of finance. The MSc Financial Technology provides an advanced education in the multiple converging skills and knowledge bases that are required by the organisations of the future.7 core coursesOptional coursesFintech Pathways Project, choosing from an Industry, Start-up or Research PathwayFor more information about the programme, please visit Glasgow website here :https://www.gla.ac.uk
[CARD]
PROGRAMME STRUCTURE
PROGRAMME STRUCTURE

The MSc Financial Technology provides an advanced education in the multiple converging skills and knowledge bases that are required by the organisations of the future.7 core coursesOptional coursesFintech Pathways Project, choosing from an Industry, Start-up or Research PathwayFor more information about the programme, please visit Glasgow website here :https://www.gla.ac.uk
